posts.post_content:
So green now has:  
  
Instant-speed "destroy non-evasive attacking creature" for ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) that doubles as a creature in a pinch.  
[Sorcery-speed creature removal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=220383) for ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol), provided you have a tougher creature.  
[Instant-speed anything removal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=221533) for ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) that gives your opponent an elephant, or doubles as a creature in a pinch.  
[Sorcery-speed creature removal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=220283) for ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol), provided you don't target anything too big.  
[Sorcery-speed creature removal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=245250) for ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) that gives you a token maker, provided you don't target anything too big.  
  
When I started playing, green couldn't touch creatures outside of combat. And I started playing 8 months ago.  
  
@Atogatogatogatogatogatog: Sure, but Bramblecrush is much more in line with what green usually gets to kill.
posts.html:
So green now has:

Instant-speed "destroy non-evasive attacking creature" for that doubles as a creature in a pinch.
Sorcery-speed creature removal for , provided you have a tougher creature.
Instant-speed anything removal for that gives your opponent an elephant, or doubles as a creature in a pinch.
Sorcery-speed creature removal for , provided you don't target anything too big.
Sorcery-speed creature removal for that gives you a token maker, provided you don't target anything too big.

When I started playing, green couldn't touch creatures outside of combat. And I started playing 8 months ago.

@Atogatogatogatogatogatog: Sure, but Bramblecrush is much more in line with what green usually gets to kill.

Posted By: Atogatogatog (9/23/2011 11:44:18 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card and [Prey Upon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prey Upon) are the reason that I decided to splash green in my otherwise red/black aggro vampire deck at the prerelease. I felt nervous about splashing a third color, given that there were very few mana fixers in my card pool. There were a few times when I drew a Forest when I needed a Swamp, on the whole, however, I feel it was a worthwhile investment. After all, it did kill my opponent's [Essence of the Wild](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Essence of the Wild) before the Avatar got out of control.

Posted By: Aun (9/24/2011 12:55:35 AM)
Rating:

@Eved: "French" vanilla means a vanilla creature with one or two keyword abilities.

That said, I love this card. He's functionally at least an instant that destroys a non-evasive attacking creature. He can also double as a reasonably scary attacker on the battlefield. That, and he fits the flavor perfectly. Not to mention: green doesn't usually get creature removal (Beast Within kind of has us spoiled, I'll admit).

5/5

posts.post_content:
A nice cousin to [Winged Coatl](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Winged Coatl).  
This one is more likely to be blocked when it attacks, and it makes up for that with the added power.  
  
It blows up attacking creature without first strike, and if you really need a 2/1, you can drop it during your opponent's end step to swing with the following turn.
posts.html:
A nice cousin to Winged Coatl.
This one is more likely to be blocked when it attacks, and it makes up for that with the added power.

It blows up attacking creature without first strike, and if you really need a 2/1, you can drop it during your opponent's end step to swing with the following turn.

posts.post_content: Perfect Green creature removal. This is what green removal should look like, in the form of creatures. And yes 1/2 body would have been more relevant with deathtouch, but 2/1 is nice too. You could pop him at end of opponents turn, (or 2 of him) and then overrun for the win. Good little surprise. Or, in extended, if they dont swing drop him then on ur turn play lure to nuke 2 creatures. he is a creature, and 2 power is twice as much as 1.

Posted By: Garcy21 (10/4/2011 9:37:49 AM)
Rating:

@Arachobia "Is flash really that worth it?"

Yes. It's the ability to kill any attacking, non-evasive creature for 2. Flash and deathtouch (no pun originally intended, but now 100% intended) is a killer combination. No one doubts the power of the cards you mentioned, but any of those cards let your opponent have a chance to play around them. Flash allows for the element of surprise that can catch your opponent's best creatures. Deadly Recluse might keep your opponent from attacking with that big hitter. Ambush Viper will kill it.

Most likely, you aren't using this turn 2, your saving it for the big kill with your opponent tapped out. As for the 2 power... why not? If it somehow can block two creatures, or if your opponent for whatever reason blocks it with two, or if they can prevent 1 damage, or just plain ol' this is the only creature you have and your opponent has nothing you can lay it out there and swing for 2 until he answers... two is better than one, if only marginally in this... (see all)
